results.title: In our words: stories from Victorian veterans [November 2010]
results.brief_description: Nine Victorian war veterans tell of their experiences through the creation of digital stories, as part of ACMI’s Digital Storytelling workshop. While the horror and dangers and residual trauma of war are evident, these stories also pay tribute to the qualities of mateship and bravery instilled in them by the experience.
results.title_for_label: In our words: stories from Victorian veterans [November 2010]
results.description: Nine Victorian war veterans tell of their experiences through the creation of digital stories, as part of ACMI’s Digital Storytelling workshop. While the horror and dangers and residual trauma of war are evident, these stories also pay tribute to the qualities of mateship and bravery instilled in them by the experience.

While the horror and dangers and residual trauma of war are evident, these stories also pay tribute to the qualities of mateship and bravery instilled in them by the experience.

results.title: In our words: stories from Victorian veterans [Morwell veterans]
results.brief_description: Ten Victorian veterans from Morwell tell stories of their time of service, providing their unique perspectives on army life, wartime and coming home to Australia. Produced with the assistance of Morwell RSL and the students of Kurnai College, Morwell.
results.title_for_label: In our words: stories from Victorian veterans [Morwell veterans]
results.description: Ten Victorian veterans from Morwell tell stories of their time of service, providing their unique perspectives on army life, wartime and coming home to Australia. Produced with the assistance of Morwell RSL and the students of Kurnai College, Morwell.
description_for_label: Ten Victorian veterans from Morwell tell stories of their time of service, providing their unique perspectives on army life, wartime and coming home to Australia. Produced with the assistance of Morwell RSL and the students of Kurnai College, Morwell.

results.title: Tour of duty
results.creator_credit: Paul Rayment, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: While he saw it as his duty to defend his country against communism, it wasn’t until Paul Rayment went to Vietnam that he realised how lucky Australia really was. However, on his return, Rayment became estranged from his community and friends, and it took a while to rebuild those ties and his connection to the country he had earlier set out to defend.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul Rayment, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: While he saw it as his duty to defend his country against communism, it wasn’t until Paul Rayment went to Vietnam that he realised how lucky Australia really was. However, on his return, Rayment became estranged from his community and friends, and it took a while to rebuild those ties and his connection to the country he had earlier set out to defend.
description_for_label: While he saw it as his duty to defend his country against communism, it wasn’t until Paul Rayment went to Vietnam that he realised how lucky Australia really was. However, on his return, Rayment became estranged from his community and friends, and it took a while to rebuild those ties and his connection to the country he had earlier set out to defend.

results.title: The Things you do for a beer
results.creator_credit: Steve Whelan, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When World War II broke out, some men would do anything to sign up and when the war was over, most men would do anything for a beer. Steve Whelan came from a family of servicemen and was eager to do his bit. He tells the story of how he and a group of fellow prisoners of war found a way to escape and find a beer.
results.title_for_label: The Things you do for a beer
results.creator_credit_for_label: Steve Whelan, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: When World War II broke out, some men would do anything to sign up and when the war was over, most men would do anything for a beer. results.title: Sink or swim
results.creator_credit: Gwynneth Cole, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When Gwynneth Cole joined the army in 1944, roles for women were limited. While Cole didn’t get to serve on the front line, she was posted to different bases in Australia as a nurse and faced many hardships and the realities of war. Cole greatly values her time in the army and reflects on the opportunities for women and the independent streak she has passed on to her four daughters.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gwynneth Cole, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: When Gwynneth Cole joined the army in 1944, roles for women were limited. While Cole didn’t get to serve on the front line, she was posted to different bases in Australia as a nurse and faced many hardships and the realities of war. Cole greatly values her time in the army and reflects on the opportunities for women and the independent streak she has passed on to her four daughters.

results.title: Singapore dollars
results.creator_credit: Edward Dunstan, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Edward Dunstan served in the Australian Navy for 20 years, spending a significant part of that time in Singapore. While he enjoyed his time there, Dunstan also has some bad memories, not least of all was how he was received by his fellow Australians on his return. However, these experiences have encouraged him to help others through his work at the RSL.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Edward Dunstan, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Edward Dunstan served in the Australian Navy for 20 years, spending a significant part of that time in Singapore. However, these experiences have encouraged him to help others through his work at the RSL.

However, these experiences have encouraged him to help others through his work at the RSL.

results.title: A Look from their side
results.creator_credit: Robert Cole, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Reflecting on his service in Borneo during World War II, Robert Cole was impressed by the kindness and warmth of the local people, despite being forced to live through war and poverty. In doing so, they taught Cole about gratitude.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Cole, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Reflecting on his service in Borneo during World War II, Robert Cole was impressed by the kindness and warmth of the local people, despite being forced to live through war and poverty. In doing so, they taught Cole about gratitude.

results.title: Leave no man behind
results.creator_credit: Les Maher, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Even though Les Maher believed you should never leave a man behind, there was a time in Vietnam that he had to make the decision to do so. Decades later, Maher has never forgotten and endeavoured to fulfil his promise.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Les Maher, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Fishing on the Diamantina
results.creator_credit: Wayne Gwynne, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Wayne Gwynne joined the Navy in 1960 when he was 17. Spending 5 years at sea, during peacetime, Gwynne got to see things that no one has seen before. While he still can’t talk about those things, he loved his time at sea, especially on his favourite ship, the ‘Diamantina’.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Wayne Gwynne, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Wayne Gwynne joined the Navy in 1960 when he was 17. Spending 5 years at sea, during peacetime, Gwynne got to see things that no one has seen before. While he still can’t talk about those things, he loved his time at sea, especially on his favourite ship, the ‘Diamantina’.

results.title: The Boy who came in from the cold
results.creator_credit: Jack Darling, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Alfred (Jack) Darling was a gunner on the ANZAC during the Korean War. The boys came up with as many ways as possible to overcome the Korean winter, including growing a beard, which required permission from the captain.
results.title_for_label: The Boy who came in from the cold
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jack Darling, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
